snippet: If pro-gun members of Congress have their way, they will continue to bar federally financed research on the roots of gun violence and how to prevent it.
abstract: Editorial decries Republican effort to thwart new federally-funded research on gun violence; argues that such research, which is vehemently opposed by the gun lobby, has the potential to fundamentally transform the debate on gun control and to save thousands of lives.
lead_paragraph: If pro-gun members of Congress have their way, they will continue to bar federally financed research on the roots of gun violence and how to prevent it.
